messages.subject: New member
messages.msgSnippet: Hallo! This group sounds very interesting. I m happy to find this group. I have a web-page www.sharpweaponcenter.com  . This
messages.messageBody:
Hallo!



This group sounds very interesting. I'm happy to find this group.



I have a web-page www.sharpweaponcenter.com
<http://www.sharpweaponcenter.com/> . This page is Sweden's biggest page
about Japanese swords with forum and facts. I have around 262 members.

I have working on this page since 2002. The page has become bigger than I
thought. Today I have around 120 visitors every day.



If you have some information you want to tell the Swedish collectors about
Japanese swords just send a mail.



Yours,



Per- Erik (Pelle) Eriksson

<mailto:pelle@...> pelle@...

<http://www.sharpweaponcenter.com> www.sharpweaponcenter.com





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New member  // Verne's Sword
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Curran, What can I do to provide better photos? What angles and such? I ll also make precise measurments. A polish would bring out the hamon much clearer, I
messages.messageBody:
Hi Curran,

What can I do to provide better photos? What angles
and such? I'll also make precise measurments.
A polish would bring out the hamon much clearer, I had
one local collector look at it and he felt that it was
Koto period and also cut down as you stated. Blade
light and superbly balanced...feels like an extension
of your hand.

Thanks
Verne

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New member  // Verne's Sword
messages.msgSnippet: Verne, I cannot tell a lot from your sword photos. I wish someone more experienced would step in and comment, as I don t think I am very qualified with less
messages.messageBody:
Verne,

I cannot tell a lot from your sword photos. I wish
someone more experienced would step in and comment, as
I don't think I am very qualified with less than 5
years experience. Take my comments just as a beginning
point and allow for the fact that others may feel I am
absolutely wrong.

The kissaki looks chu to ko-kissaki and front part
tapers quickly. What is the length of the cutting
edge?
Tobiyaki (if correct term) is associated with
So-Den. My feeling off the sword is that it is Shinto
and hastily shortened for WW2 mounts. Out of polish,
unsigned, and just photos....very hard for me to tell.
I may be entirely misreading the blade, but am
operating under the belief that few if any WWII smiths
executed tobiyaki. I do not know which Shinto or
Shinshinto schools did.

Curran

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: This just in
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Verne, I guess they ( the police/government ) need people to be honest enough to come forward with any un registered swords. This does not effect genuine
messages.messageBody:
Hi Verne, I guess they ( the police/government ) need people to be
honest enough to come forward with any un registered swords. This does
not effect genuine collectors, though they will need to have a permit
and a Alarm on their house. Importing swords will be a different matter.
A license would have to be produced then I would assume. Also, I am in
Perth and visit Victoria as often as I can ( I am from there originally
) and taking any swords in with me will also be interesting.

My major concern is the amount of old WW2 swords that widows and the
like may have that are handed in to be destroyed. These swords are not
the problem, it is the junk you buy from sports and knive stores that
are the real problem.

There is more information coming in soon. I will forward what I get as I
get it, or Barry will.

Cheers

Rich Turner

> How will this affect antique sword collections and how will they

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New member  // Verne's Sword
messages.msgSnippet: Vern & Robert, I figured someone would comment with more knowledge than me. But I ll try and further discussion on it. Those with more knowledge
messages.messageBody:
Vern & Robert,

I figured someone would comment with more knowledge
than me. But I'll try and further discussion on it.
Those with more knowledge ___PLEASE___correct me.

Very -off the cuff- impression is it was later Shinto
or Shinshinto shortened to fit WW II mounts. Little
guess as to school. I have much to learn about
ShinShinto.
I don't know much either about WWII mounts, so not
sure how much that would trim. Would move the machi up
considerably and leave a bright nakago mune behind?
Does seem to my eye to have tobiyaki, so I thought
that was a good sign.
I wondered about the geometry on the kissaki and
would like to see the sugata/shape of the whole sword.


Curran

> near the machi. I haven't seen this before. Would
> this indicate a
> recent machi repair, or a tight habaki that is
> burnishing the nakago?
>
> Bob

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] New member
messages.msgSnippet: Does anyone have any comments on Verne s sword?  Admittedly it is difficult to see the hamon in his photos, but he is describing Tobiyaki.  Also, it is
messages.messageBody:
Does anyone have any comments on Verne's sword? Admittedly it is
difficult to see the hamon in his photos, but he is describing
Tobiyaki. Also, it is interesting to see how the nakago mune is shiny
near the machi. I haven't seen this before. Would this indicate a
recent machi repair, or a tight habaki that is burnishing the nakago?

Bob
Verne wrote:

>Hello for Florida, Just joined and am fairly new to japanese sword
>collecting. I have created an album under Verne and they are pics of
>a sword I just found at an antique shop.Would like some opinons, not
>signed. Could be a shorted katana bordering on wakasashi length. The
>sword had just been brought in by a WW2 vet's widow of which he will
>give me her name to verify the story.I need help on identifying the
>hamo, it is active and on both side there are a couple of pea shaped
>temper spots floating over the main temper.
>Thanks
>Verne
>
>
>
>

--
Robert J. Gilmore, MS, DVM
<rgilmore82@...>

messages.subject: This just in
messages.msgSnippet: This just in from Barry Thomas Rich, The Vic Gov has banned swords - announced y day and in today s Herald Sun page 11.  I m still off-air so can t notify the
messages.messageBody:
This just in from Barry Thomas

Rich,

The Vic Gov has banned swords - announced y'day and in today's Herald Sun page 11. I'm still off-air so can't notify the world, but I guess there's no hurry. More details later as they come to hand.

Look to your freedom campaign in WA...

Regards

Barry

messages.subject: New member
messages.msgSnippet: Hello for Florida, Just joined and am fairly new to japanese sword collecting. I have created an album under Verne and they are pics of a sword I just found at
messages.messageBody:
Hello for Florida, Just joined and am fairly new to japanese sword
collecting. I have created an album under Verne and they are pics of
a sword I just found at an antique shop.Would like some opinons, not
signed. Could be a shorted katana bordering on wakasashi length. The
sword had just been brought in by a WW2 vet's widow of which he will
give me her name to verify the story.I need help on identifying the
hamo, it is active and on both side there are a couple of pea shaped
temper spots floating over the main temper.
Thanks
Verne
